column1:
## Reason for hospitalizaiton
69-year-old man admitted on 2024-01-01 with shortness of breath that he got a couple of days after a trip to Spain.

## Medical history
Parkinson's disease. Hypertension. Deep vein thrombosis bilaterally in Spain four months ago.

## Hospital stay 
DT pulmonary arteries without signs of pulmonary embolism or pericardial fluid. Normal ejection fraction. MetHb 5.6. Hb 96. No infection-signs in lab. Hence hypoxia and anemia of unclear nature. Received oxygen. Hb initially falling from 96 to 83. Target saturation > 90%. It appears that the patient had unprotected sex and had a fever and skin rash as a result. Also weight loss of 10kg since October. Positive HIV test. Was informed about the diagnosis and antiviral therapy (Truvada and Tivicay) was started after consultation with the infection diseases doctor. Lab with image as in hemolytic anemia after discussion with the hematologist. In the neurological status we forund bradykinesia, rigidity as in Parkinson's disease and positive Babinski's sign was found bilaterally. Additionally, fasciculations in the hands. MRI of the brain and spinal cord was negative for findings of ALS or Parkinson's plus. Electromyography was performed and showed findings consistent with diffuse lower motor neuron involvement. LP with no anomalous findings so far. No neuromuscular etiology has been found. Neurological symptoms can be explained by HIV infection? Patient stable on room air with oxygen saturation of 94% and is discharged from the ward.

## Current medications
- Omeprazole (Omeprazole) PO 20 Mg 1+0+0
- Eliquis (Apixaban) PO 5 Mg 1+0+1
- Betolvex (Cyanocobalamin) PO 1 Mg 1+0+0
- Madopark (Benserazide, Levodopa) PO 100/25 Mg 2+1+1+1
- Requip Depot (Ropinirole) PO 4 Mg 2+0+0
- Mirtazapine (Mirtazapine) PO 15 Mg 0+0+1
- Tivicay (Dolutegravir) PO 50 Mg 0+0+0
- Truvada (Emtricitabine/Tenofovir disoproxil) PO

## Plan after discharge
Scheduled outpatient follow-up with infectious disease and neurology specialists.

## Diagnosis
- Parkinson's disease
- Hypertension
- Deep vein thrombosis

## Primary diagnosis (name and ICD code)
B23.8 HIV infection
D59.9 Acquired hemolytic anemia, unspecified
